meanings.definition: Give a concrete form to (an abstract concept).
meanings.sent1: She imbodied her dreams by turning them into beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent2: The artist imbodied the feeling of joy in her sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The idea of friendship was imbodied in the form of a loyal dog in the story.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was imbodied in every note he played on the piano.
meanings.sent5: The essence of happiness was imbodied in the laughter of children playing.

meanings.sent1: The superhero imbodied courage and justice in the comic book.
meanings.sent2: The character in the novel imbodied the spirit of resilience.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the villain imbodied all the mischief in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness imbodied the true meaning of compassion.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl imbodied wisdom and knowledge in the forest.
